bug.author: Jackyinuo
bug.summary: why all the "image_id"s of "yolov5s_predictions.json" are the same ID? "yolov5s_predictions.json" is the prediction of yolov5s ,which is in the task of "test" on the dev-test2017.
bug.description:
Before submitting a bug report, please be aware that your issue must be reproducible with all of the following, otherwise it is non-actionable, and we can not help you:
Current repo: run git fetch && git status -uno to check and git pull to update repo Common dataset: coco.yaml or coco128.yaml Common environment: Colab, Google Cloud, or Docker image. See https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5#environments
If this is a custom dataset/training question you must include your train*.jpg, test*.jpg and results.png figures, or we can not help you. You can generate these with utils.plot_results(). <denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what the bug is. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Input: <denchmark-code>import torch
a = torch.tensor([5]) c = a / 0 </denchmark-code>
Output: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/glennjocher/opt/anaconda3/envs/env1/lib/python3.7/site-packages/IPython/core/interactiveshell.py", line 3331, in run_code exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns) File "<ipython-input-5-be04c762b799>", line 5, in <module> c = a / 0 RuntimeError: ZeroDivisionError </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
OS: [e.g. Ubuntu] GPU [e.g. 2080 Ti]
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jackyinuo>@Jackyinuo</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in YOLOv5! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki#tutorials>Tutorials</denchmark-link> to get started, where you can find quickstart guides for simple tasks like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Data Training</denchmark-link> all the way to advanced concepts like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/607>Hyperparameter Evolution</denchmark-link> . If this is a üêõ Bug Report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom training Question, please provide as much information as possible, including dataset images, training logs, screenshots, and a public link to online <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data#visualize>W&B logging</denchmark-link> if available. For business inquiries or professional support requests please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> or email Glenn Jocher at <denchmark-link:mailto:glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com>glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Requirements</denchmark-h>
Python 3.8 or later with all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link> dependencies installed, including . To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt <denchmark-h:h2>Environments</denchmark-h>
YOLOv5 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov5 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov5. See Docker Quickstart Guide
<denchmark-h:h2>Status</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg></denchmark-link>
If this badge is green, all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/actions>YOLOv5 GitHub Actions</denchmark-link> Continuous Integration (CI) tests are currently passing. CI tests verify correct operation of YOLOv5 training (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> ), testing (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/test.py>test.py</denchmark-link> ), inference (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/detect.py>detect.py</denchmark-link> ) and export (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/blob/master/models/export.py>export.py</denchmark-link> ) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu every 24 hours and on every commit.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jackyinuo>@Jackyinuo</denchmark-link> image_id is set here for each detection. These are only utilized if your dataset is COCO.
Thank you for your reply. This is caused by a small mistake.@
